intro: Afrodaphne minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered sandarac tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in tropical dry forests and scrublands. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and its ability to produce a resin known as sandarac, which has been used historically in various industries. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a glossy appearance, while its bark is thick and fissured. Afrodaphne minutiflora plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
